document.title: North Carolina Standard Course of Study

8E33D3D65344452D96FF226B1894FE88.description: Recognize and draw examples and non-examples of types of quadrilaterals including rhombuses, rectangles, squares, parallelograms, and trapezoids.

DCBF5430DFEC4A399CFD160BF6DAD8F0.description: Investigate, describe, and reason about composing triangles and quadrilaterals and decomposing quadrilaterals.

5EDF5CB3B3794B1EA7195C84B620835F.description: Reason with two-dimensional shapes and their attributes.

BD249A75B69246E8A775E507E47FB5D7.description: Reason with shapes and their attributes.

BDAF13438E834F2F8976CEFD47CB02B7.description: Solve problems involving perimeters of polygons, including finding the perimeter given the side lengths, and finding an unknown side length.

6DADAD2982044428BBAF13CEBAFA1D24.description: Use tiles and/or arrays to illustrate and explain that the area of a rectangle can be found by partitioning it into two smaller rectangles, and that the area of the large rectangle is the sum of the two smaller rectangles.

353B7B9FE68C4244923C58259290FEE8.description: Multiply side lengths to find areas of rectangles with whole-number side lengths in the context of solving problems, and represent whole-number products as rectangular areas in mathematical reasoning.

F4E72F276C0748F5851BF1E987452334.description: Find the area of a rectangle with whole-number side lengths by tiling it, and show that the area is the same as would be found by multiplying the side lengths.

1186D6FEDEEE4F6280F4D17D357DB123.description: Relate area to the operations of multiplication and addition.

F806763680E14108B2894A95D7CDF1BA.description: Find the area of a rectangle with whole-number side lengths by tiling without gaps or overlaps and counting unit squares

BC681A715C634751919E1DDF78BAADFC.description: Solve one and two-step “how many more” and “how many less” problems using information from these graphs.

97BB25DEF29142859501CCE62FE7F49E.description: Make a representation of data and interpret data in a frequency table, scaled picture graph, and/or scaled bar graph with axes provided.

D1A671BEBEAF4DEFBAD2E536E8016866.description: Collect data by asking a question that yields data in up to four categories.

36E1ED75CBC743FD9B8D82A846A062A1.description: Represent and interpret scaled picture and bar graphs:

45A32C9C7D3E444D84F20BAC9683BFC9.description: Add, subtract, multiply, or divide to solve one-step word problems involving whole number measurements of length, weight, and capacity in the same customary units.

FE3B2E97E8F84550B29B8C71A7A7847D.description: Estimate and measure capacity and weight in customary units to a whole number: cups, pints, quarts, gallons, ounces, and pounds.

42FA4708525D45009651648518599FC5.description: Estimate and measure lengths in customary units to the quarter-inch and half-inch, and feet and yards to the whole unit.

00E4EE296F5E44B7AF1213153FBDE675.description: Tell and write time to the nearest minute. Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of time intervals within the same hour.

4EEEF06145504D34AB0E7FB101C8C969.description: Compare two fractions with the same numerator or the same denominator by reasoning about their size, using area and length models, and using the >, <, and = symbols. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two fractions refer to the same whole with denominators: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds and sixths.

5E2800712B2C4F4FB79C823390026CD1.description: Expressing whole numbers as fractions, and recognize fractions that are equivalent to whole numbers.

2EB62079538B4D25B057851378BF08C8.description: Explaining that a fraction with the same numerator and denominator equals one whole.

2122C5ECED064C69B079AF35B533C362.description: Composing and decomposing fractions into equivalent fractions using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds and sixths.

3014AABEBBCD47539FEC3662EC1DC5B7.description: Represent equivalent fractions with area and length models by:

92CE9D214052411D9EBF65162BE03078.description: Using a number line, explain that the numerator of a fraction represents the number of lengths of the unit fraction from 0.

A28C542C2A9F4ECE84E7C7E6898B034F.description: Using an area model, explain that the numerator of a fraction represents the number of equal parts of the unit fraction.

EDE5292A42F5435BADD217C3DAF8F6B5.description: Interpret fractions with denominators of 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 using area and length models

A2DDE10C282541BDB34BB04CFF5084BE.description: Represent and identify unit fractions using area and length models.

0A45DAD4462E40839A0EAE45C3B3B12C.description: Explain that a unit fraction is one of those parts

42BBE9D1510F429C8068EE7093B61D37.description: Interpret unit fractions with denominators of 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 as quantities formed when a whole is partitioned into equal parts;

9E96DA3EEC4B4BEAA16D3CEAA010315D.description: Use concrete and pictorial models, based on place value and the properties of operations, to find the product of a one-digit whole number by a multiple of 10 in the range 10–90.

4D0DC220EB1C4B8DB72305E882870576.description: Generalize place value understanding for multi-digit numbers.

D0F75425D7834445BD20D3A23D29CF90.description: Use expanded form to decompose numbers and then find sums and differences.

B5C351D62E344799BD2B52605081C8A3.description: Model and explain how the relationship between addition and subtraction can be applied to solve addition and subtraction problems

8127ED527A984E1EA2EFAE51DE3A5B0A.description: Use estimation strategies to assess reasonableness of answers

3CA0C2616F0E4ADEA4043B788C0F1E35.description: Add and subtract whole numbers up to and including 1,000.

57E30BFB4B96401BA4F2F9F9E1EB6E77.description: Use place value to add and subtract.

1FD5C9B64FD74BA8AADDE1DE836ABAD6.description: Number and Operations in Base Ten

E873F438360F4A94B8C49419BE97405D.description: Interpret patterns of multiplication on a hundreds board and/or multiplication table.

F5AC7740F2CC4576826964FBDFB8588C.description: Solve two-step word problems using addition, subtraction, and multiplication, representing problems using equations with a symbol for the unknown number

49B5BA8B56664EA6BD6C85B907487050.description: Determine the unknown whole number in a multiplication or division equation relating three whole numbers.

5D7BE68E1D1845C695963D89E2D6E6D6.description: Illustrate and explain using the relationship between multiplication and division.

F2749B3B3B7743CE922E341752F11981.description: Know from memory all products with factors up to and including 10.

3F6AF20A8FDE4DACA1069A907A55B6B9.description: Demonstrate fluency with multiplication and division with factors, quotients and divisors up to and including 10.

C7205B7519A943D6A0D37A2D90EC5A0C.description: Solve an unknown-factor problem, by using division strategies and/or changing it to a multiplication problem.

B646D1D4DEC043449D7CAF6696B8D10F.description: Understand properties of multiplication and the relationship between multiplication and division.

5381A3FE665B49D2B16BC628675A4DC7.description: Solve division word problems with a divisor and quotient up to and including 10. Represent the problem using arrays, pictures, repeated subtraction and/or equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.

77F3EF898E2B41E391CF7ACBE74C803E.description: Solve multiplication word problems with factors up to and including 10. Represent the problem using arrays, pictures, and/or equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.

0BA7889DA2454B45A7AD1421A73EF509.description: Represent, interpret, and solve one-step problems involving multiplication and division.

705648E30B324DEEB95833226E727822.description: Illustrate and explain strategies including arrays, repeated addition or subtraction, and decomposing a factor.

158510D6CF794205B395A717467987E8.description: Interpret the divisor and quotient in a division equation as representing the number of equal groups and the number of objects in each group.

424162DB670644B8A70A602E9103DFE6.description: For whole-number quotients of whole numbers with a one-digit divisor and a one-digit quotient:

C8E265B8913D461991F4DBCAA6A1388D.description: Illustrate and explain strategies including arrays, repeated addition, decomposing a factor, and applying the commutative and associative properties.

6016E985A576473BB84B870FA450E4F1.description: Interpret the factors as representing the number of equal groups and the number of objects in each group.

979D1E88EAC748CF9DCF01B7341A0BD1.description: For products of whole numbers with two factors up to and including 10:

779A6CB9798F4AA1BD907A587AADAFFF.description: Represent and solve problems involving multiplication and division.

0D212CCF8AFC4DC0A6BB176133C41910.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

FE73D9B1E6234A7997EF25FB97709790.description: Look for and make use of structure.

20808536B67F4E67BE1969A13AEA4CE1.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

8A0123D83C854009B46537A571BE5385.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

C08CB8AE44B24BB486EE61B6B369F3CC.description: NC Standards Course of Study - Math Grade 3 (2018)
